Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately identify and illustrate two distinct habitats, such as a forest habitat and an ocean habitat, with clear and detailed drawings.

The student can precisely observe and include various types of living things in each habitat, such as depicting trees, squirrels, and birds in a forest habitat, and fish, seaweed, and crabs in an ocean habitat.
The student can effectively compare and depict the diversity of plants and animals in each habitat, showing the differences in biodiversity with attention to detail.
The student can clearly illustrate patterns in the diversity of plant and animal life across the two habitats, using their observations creatively and effectively in the drawing.
The student can organize their drawing in a way that distinctly shows which plants and animals belong to each habitat and accurately reflects how they were observed, including appropriate labels.
CANNOT: May occasionally miss labeling a minor detail or organism in one of the habitats, although they largely understand the requirements.

Might occasionally depict an organism that is atypical or less expected for one of the habitats, requiring a teacher to prompt further explanation or justification (e.g., drawing a tropical fish in a freshwater habitat, potentially thinking it's adaptable).
